The latter is absolutely better. Zombified is just to long and redundant.
This absolutely needs to happen. Otherwise, there will be some slight confusion. (Besides, I think Zombie Piglin sounds better anyway.)
Zombie Piglin does roll off the tongue a lot easier
And Zoglins shouldn‚Äôt have such an awful name

Well, I think that calling "Zombified" is a good idea, because the language is evolving and now we have more appropiate words to describe entities.

To everyone that want to rename "Zombified" to just "Zombie", that isn't a wrong form to say "Zombified". The two forms are right. But "Zombified" is a better form to express that is a Mob that was zombified.

Also, to everyone that also say that "Zombified" is a long word, please think that there isn't only one country that speak english. Maybe for you it's very long, but for other it's okay. Also, for other languages that also have differences between "Zombie" (Noun) and "Zombified" (Verb), that isn't a probrem or an origin of discussion.
For example: In spanish there are two words: "Zombi" (zombie) and "Zombificado" (Zombified). I live on an spanish country and I have seen very much OG Minecraft players, but none of them have troubles to say "Zombificado". Even in spanish "Zombificado" is a larger word than "Zombified".

Mi final opinion is: There always will be a difference in opinion between Old & New players, but we are now in the present and changes are made. Please understand that. I hope that at least some of you will understand.

Zombie villagers need to be renamed to "Zombified Villagers", since it's very inconsistent. Just not zombie horses.

A zombie has black eyes because it first died, then came back to life. Piglins when they enter the overworld are "zombified", and the same happens to villagers when they get bit. They don't get black eyes, they just have red pupils. They're infected. The zombie horse's name is fine and can be left as is, since they have black eyes showing that they died first and weren't infected.
Agreed, rabbits and foxes who both jump need an increase resistance to fall damage!
yep
Ojala te lean
This is especially relevant now that we're getting much taller mountains and cliffs!
I'd really want a pet rabbit but thats impossible because they're really afraid of me
sadly my best bunny toast died even the 20 of them in the adoption center.

I agree. I keep finding snow bunnies on a mountain by my house and I want to keep one, but it is impossible to get them off the mountain safely without them dying of fall damage. I don‚Äôt want to have to build a minecart system just to get them to my house, and getting them in the minecart will probably be difficult as well since they seem to have no path finding, they run rapidly in any direction even on a lead. Bunnies should have increased fall damage like the mountain goats. Also why do goats jump 10 blocks and bunnies barely jump a block high and take fall damage at +2 blocks? It seems like it should be the opposite in my opinion. I wish this thread had more votes so mojang would take notice to it.

This. In addition I believe rabbits are bugged in Java Edition. I built a completely enclosed glass cage only 2 blocks high for rabbits to avoid all fall damage. Nonetheless over time my rabbits completely disappear. There is a lighting rod in range but I don't believe that lightning should be able to go through glass. Also it is lit, so hostile mobs don't spawn. I have no explanation except that rabbits are so incredibly fragile that even in these conditions they are taking damage and dying.

Rabbits are definitely in desperate need of a rework. Not only does any given population of Rabbits go extinct incredibly quickly due to a fall damage liability and predators, their movement AI is also broken, getting them stuck on block ledges often and their drops are incredibly mid at best and useless at worst.

Making them more resistant to fall damage would already be a great change imo (and fixing their AI), but I have a few more suggestions.

  • First, due to being preyed upon so much I would suggest that they should be able to passively breed on their own without any input from the player, so they can "breed like rabbits", as the saying goes.
  • Second, I think they should be actually tameable or at the very least, stop running from the player after being fed by them once, so they can be more easily kept.
  • Third, I think the usefulness of their drops need a bit of a boost, be that by giving them more use cases, such as adding more items that can only exclusively be crafted with them (like bundles) and/or boosting the existing items you can craft (like making rabbit stew stackable)

Because as they are now, they are barely set dressing.
With the recent visual changes made to rabbits, it feels like the right time to bring this back up

I just want to he able to bring rabbits to my house but they die every time. Idc if I can transport them with a happy ghast, they are in an enclosure with barely any height difference and still take fall damage by running away. Having a flat enclosure is just sad.

I feel this is a useful idea, many people believe the phantoms are little more then a Nuisance, being able to use them in this way would change that, however there would be some balancing issues, it certainly shouldn't be anywhere nearly as fast as the elytra, 10 minecraft days isn't that long, the elytra should be the superior option do to it's difficult of obtaining.

Perhaps you could have to keep feeding it food or it will be hostile again?

I think this is a good idea, and I like the idea of riding a phantom around. However, phantoms in Minecraft only survive during the night, so what would happen to them during the day? Otherwise, I think this would be a great update to have in Minecraft rather than having to install any mods. Nice idea!

When they are tamed, they should not burn. Like, by taming them, you heal their soul, repairing them, making them better. This way, it would seem less of just taming them as you actually helping them become better. Also, the only way that they could be faster than an elytra would be by feeding them a new item called the charged fruit. You get this by crafting a popped chorus fruit with 8 sugar, then getting 9 of those. That's what you feed them. Then they will go at elytra speeds.You just won't be able to fly by cats, and they will always resist you when flying by fish or endermen, as they would want a tasty snack.
Good idea
I like this idea.
This is a good idea but they would need to be able to survive in the day

                                                         Stick

And an upgraded version (this gives the armor points) where the empty slots are filled with gold or iron or even diamonds

This is a great idea, it doesn't matter if they burn in the day, we'd find shelter during the day for them, if they hit us, we'd be consuming healing potions, if the chorus fruit is not enough for game balance you could use wither roses, if this is not enough balance you could make it required to put an elytra on them that wears over time, but the phantoms looks amazing and if on top of that we could aim at the enemies and shoot without having to turn their direction that'd be very nice.

Yeah I think they should vary like horses you‚Äôll be able to breed them but they never are quite as fast as elytra but they are an animal so you don‚Äôt need gunpowder and paper just whatever to heal them if they take damage, honestly would love to be able to ride them and build, maybe they can only be used in the End and Nether since they die in sunlight, or maybe we can make waxed armor or a helmet and stop that.

?? I feel we need more tamed creatures, but this takes the purpose of Minecraft away, taming hostile mobs...
Yes but it would make minecraft like a game where u are like "yeaaaa I have all my friends yeewaaa"
It would not be cool.  It makes absolutely no sense to be able to tame anything, and it is way too overpowered.

Why not have different requirements for each animal? For a cat, it would visit you if you have fish, and then visit you every day at the same time expecting fish. After a few days, it is then 'tamed'. 

Foxes could be similar, and could even 'nest' in your back garden if there are berry bushes. To tame them, you would have to follow a similar process like with the cat.

Also, if name tags were made of gold, it would be nice, as it would be like a 'dog-tag'. Also, if we could dye collars that would be nice. Collars could be leads.
NO!!! That makes Minecraft way too easy!
I really want this. One time, I lured a spider in my house and trapped it, and said he was my pet. But I had to kill him because he was too close to my bed to fall asleep.

It would definitely be interesting to be able to craft a fishing rod with bait that has a higher chance of catching fish instead of non-fish items.  Maybe also have something to craft with the rod that repels fish and so you‚Äôre more likely to get non-fish items.

I‚Äôm not entirely sure what adding more kinds of fish would add, and I‚Äôm also not sure what more enchantments would be useful.

Novos frutos... e tamb√©m devia ser poss√≠vel colocar as flores na carapa√ßa de relva dele. Hi, I'd like to share some thoughts about the sniffer mob and the new cherry blossom biome. He could bring huge new plants, large, medium. New fruit... and it should also be possible to place the flowers in its grass shell. They could also increase his size as a final phase to be proportionate to the bones we found. It could be tamed and set up as a "motorhome" with a driver's seat and "home/base support" for a bed, trunk and work desk. They could be driven by a cherry fishing rod; and when mounted and without the cane he would follow the scent of cherry trees as a "primordial home of the sniffer" and mob motif, "getting home" being able to "rest" at last (he would age and lay his eggs). He could meet his end by turning into a bush of special flowers. He could also swim with the player on top. In the new Biome, the drop of cherries could be added; petal fall; a new village of cherry trees; flowery paths; and a place of "nests" (where sniffers used to come to lay their eggs). If they put the village, they could add small lakes/water wells; also make villagers archers and give this worktable a function. They could make a pillager post not far away and the pillagers want to hunt the sniffers for some unknown reason; so the villagers being passive creatures would have a reason to use weapons. To defend and protect former friends.

Ol√°, gostaria de compartilhar algumas ideias sobre o mob sniffer e o novo bioma de cerejeira. Ele podia trazer imensas plantas novas, grandes, m√©dias. Novos frutos... e tamb√©m desvia ser poss√≠vel colocar as flores na carapa√ßa de relva dele. Tamb√©m pude aumentar o tamanho dele como uma fase final de processo para fornecer as ossadas que encontramos. Ele poderia ser domesticado e ser montado como uma "autocaravana" tendo lugar de condutor e "casa/suporte base" para por cama, ba√∫ e mesa de trabalho. Podia ser cuidados por uma cana de pesca de cereja; e quando montado e sem a cana ele seguisse o cheiro a cerejeiras como um "lar primordial do sniffer" e motivo do mob, "chegar a casa" podendo "descansar" finalmente (ele envelheceria e poria os seus ovos). Ele poderia ter o seu fim transformado se num arbusto de flores especiais. Ele conseguiria nadar tamb√©m com o jogador em cima. No Bioma novo poderia ser adicionados o drop de cerejas; queda de p√©talas; uma vila nova de cerejeiras; caminhos floridos; e um lugar de "ninhos" (onde antigamente os sniffers vinham depositar os ovos). Caso colocassem a vila podiam acrescentar pequenos lagos/po√ßos de √°gua; tamb√©m fazer os alde√µes arqueiros e dar uma fun√ß√£o ae essa mesa de trabalho. Podiam fazer um posto pilheiro n√£o muito longe e os pilheiros querem ca√ßar os sniffers por algum motivo ainda desconhecido; assim os alde√µes sendo criaturas passivas conseguem um motivo para usarem armas. Para defender e proteger os amigos antigos.

I would like to express my appreciation for the addition of the Copper Golem to Minecraft. The idea is excellent and adds a great layer of utility and charm to the game, especially for players who enjoy automated collection and storage systems.

However, after using the Copper Golem, I noticed a limitation in its storage behavior. Currently, it can only deposit items into chests that already contain the exact same item it is holding. This means the Golem doesn‚Äôt recognize items by general type or category, but rather by an exact item match.

In practice, this makes its behavior somewhat restrictive. For example, if there is a chest intended for blocks but it doesn‚Äôt yet contain the specific block the Golem wants to deposit, it won‚Äôt place the item inside. The same happens with chests for food, ores, or equipment ‚Äî the Golem only stores items if the chest already contains that exact one.

I believe it would be a great improvement if the Copper Golem could identify item categories such as building blocks, food, ores, and armor, and store them according to type rather than by exact match. This would make the Golem‚Äôs behavior more intelligent, intuitive, and useful for players who build storage or automation systems.

Such a change would significantly enhance the potential of the Copper Golem, making it not only a charming addition but also a truly functional and efficient companion in the game.

Thank you in advance for your attention,and congratulations for the update

1) Why are you giving out full names and phone numbers on a site like this

2) Your idea sounds really hard to code and also sounds pretty taxing on the game's ability to perform calculations and make the game run smoother. I don't think it would be worth the trouble, honestly. Sounds like a really good mod idea, though
MacchuPicchu96, I put full names and phone numbers because my friend an I are the people with ideas.

But I still think this idea would be too much work on computers' abilities to run the game. As an example: I remember some time ago that the devs added a feature where hostile mobs would run away from creepers that were about to explode. If memory serves well, they had to scrap the idea because even that little feature required too much computer power. Your idea - which requires mobs to be "thinking" all of the time, not just whenever a creeper is nearby - would just absolutely crush most people's performance. At least, that's the way it would seem to me.

I repeat: really cool mod idea, too much to ask for vanilla. My two cents.
